headline: King Charles
subHeadline: Kansas City Chiefs Super Bowl Incites Conspiracy Nuts; Big Tech Executives Defend Social Media Impact On Teens; Trump, Biden And Congress Divided Over Bipartisan Border Deal; Hosts Gayle King And Charles Barkley Discuss Sports In The Earlier Days With Multi-Awarded Sports Broadcaster Bob Costas; Mega Pop Star Taylor Swift Generates More Fans For NFL. Aired 10-11p ET

utterances.speaker: KAITLAN COLLINS, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: Yes, I mean, clearly, and Elmo was the one to bear the brunt of that.Doctor, it's a really serious issue that underlying this, and thank you for coming on to talk about it.

utterances.speaker: BONIOR
utterances.sentences: Thanks for having me. I really appreciate it.

utterances.speaker: COLLINS
utterances.sentences: And thank you all so much for joining us on this busy news night. I'm Kaitlan Collins. King Charles starts right now. You don't want to miss it.

utterances.speaker: GAYLE KING, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: Yes. We welcome you. We welcome you to King Charles. I'm going to try to get through this hour, though, because just a few moments ago, I walked into the glass here at CNN. So my lip is starting to swell a little bit. You see how my lip --

utterances.speaker: CHARLES BARKLEY, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: First of all, you look bright -- I mean, green. You look great, Gayle.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: My lip is starting to swell a little bit and it hurts to laugh so I'm just hoping that the lip will at least stay kind of intact.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: The perfect person to hang out with if you don't want to laugh.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: No, no, no, no, and I hit my head too.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, you don't have to worry about it. You can't hurt that.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: You can't? Have you ever had a concussion because I thought -- I said to Shelby is this a concussion?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You're doing the show with a concussion?

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Well, I'm asking. How do you know if you have -- because I hit it really -- I'm serious, I hit it very, very hard.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Come on, listen, don't -- you're fine, Gayle.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Okay, all right. Okay. We will proceed. We will proceed.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I don't even know, like you're always crazy on the show. How am I going to know if the difference between you is crazy or you had a concussion?

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I don't know, but my lip is swelling up, but we're going to go.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Let's go.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Okay. Last Sunday we all know now who is going to the Super Bowl. We all know who's going to the Super Bowl. Charles?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: The Kansas City Chiefs against the San Francisco 49ers.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: So, we should be talking about the Chiefs and the 49ers, I think, the matchups, the snacks we're going to be eating during the game, the commercials, I love the commercials. But instead, a lot of people are talking about something else.What's wrong, people? Roll the tape, please. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: JESSSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: And have you ever wondered why or how she blew up like this? Well, around four years ago, the Pentagon's psychological operations unit floated turning Taylor Swift into an asset during a NATO meeting. So, is Swift a front for a covert political agenda? Primetime obviously has no evidence. If we did, we'd share it.

utterances.speaker: ALISON STEINBERG, OAN HOST
utterances.sentences: It's a coordinated marketing campaign by Democrats to leverage celebrities to excite their base into coming out and voting.

utterances.speaker: JEANINE PIRRO, FOX NEWS HOST
utterances.sentences: Why alienate your fans, the Swifties? You know, they come across from every political ideology. Why put yourself in one area? Don't get involved. Don't get involved in politics. We don't want to see you there.KAROLINE LEAVITT, TRUMP 2024 NATIONAL PRESS SECRETARY: Let's not forget that Taylor Swift has made a career off of writing songs about picking the wrong man, so I don't think we should take advice from her now. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Boy, oh boy, conspiracies, deep state, psy ops. You are the biggest professional athlete in the room today, Charles Barkley. So you know cable news is talking about this. Do you think -- I mean, I'm almost even embarrassed to ask this question. When you hear that kind of conversation, what do you think? I don't even want to ask the question. What do you think? BARKLEY

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes. Unfortunately, they are serious.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You know, you can't even make this stuff up. It's so stupid nowadays. There's -- first of all, anybody who listens -- I'm not going to get political but anybody who listens to that stupid stupidity should be embarrassed There's no conspiracy who going to win games.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: The Super Bowl, yes.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: It is maddening to me.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: It's maddening. That's a great word.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes, it is maddening. And I also think this, in order for them to pull something like that off, so many people would have to be involved in it. That's why it just makes no sense. That's why I'm not knocking another news program, but I think you have to do your own due diligence when you listen to all these different things.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You know, for me, though --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: You really do.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I will though. But let me tell you something I am never going to listen to another Taylor Swift song again because she --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Why?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, because she made that dude from the Bills missed that field goal and I bet on the Bills. So, it's her damn fault. So, if I'm driving --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: You are saying that tongue and cheek, we should say.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Of course -- about the bet? No, I bet on the Bills.No, but the notion that Taylor Swift made my man miss the field goal, it's just so stupid and asinine.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I'm very much in favor of Travis and Taylor, whatever they're doing on that.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Do your all thing. But, man, I'm mad at her for making that guy miss that field goal.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: But maybe you shouldn't have bet.Here's something I know you're interested in, social media, the takeover of Capitol Hill. So, today, this happened today, the CEOs of Meta, TikTok, Snapchat, X, formerly known as Twitter, we all know that, they all appeared before the Senate Judiciary Committee this afternoon. Their mission, to defend social media's impact on your children. So how did it go? Here's part of the testimony today. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: MARK ZUCKERBERG, CEO, META
utterances.sentences: Mental health is a complex issue, and the existing body of scientific work has not shown a causal link between using social media and young people having worse mental health outcomes.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: So, that happened. We should say later, Mark Zuckerberg apologized to the families. He apologized only after he was really sort of forced into it by one of the senators, Josh Hawley, who was doing the questioning, saying, do you have anything to say to these families? What do you think about them being called to Capitol Hill to testify?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I have no problem with it if it brings attention, but we're all -- first of all, you know, you read all the time. I don't do social media myself. You know that.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I do.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I think it's --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: So, you're not on Twitter, you're not on Instagram?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I'm not on anything.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Why?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, because I don't want to bring fools (ph) into my life, you know, the negativity. Are there positives to it? I hear there're positives to it.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I think there's positive to it.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: But I don't want to bring anything negative into my life.First of all, Mark Zuckerberg, somebody I would love to meet one day, but you see all the time was these kids are committing suicide, because some of them they've shown on one of these platforms. I think that, number one, the parents deserve some responsibility.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes, they do.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: They do. Congress deserves some responsibility. And the company deserves some responsibility.You know, as we're doing the show, I live in Philadelphia during the summer. And I saw some idiot chop his dad's head off.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's the story today, and it was on social media for a long time.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: For hours.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes. I didn't look at it.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Me either. I don't want to see that. But I'm bothered, there should be things in place, if you're racist, sexist, homophobic, any of that stuff, any type of violence, it should be cut off immediately. You know, we were talking to our -- the group who put our stuff together. They're like, no, it was on social media for hours. This guy's head chopped off. I thought you're a moron if you want to go see that. Why would you want to see that?But these companies -- like I said, I don't blame them for everything. Like I said, that's parental guidance, that's important. Congress should have been passing laws many, many years ago saying, hey, if you show violence, we're going to punish you. Now it's too late. You're trying to put the toothpaste back in the tube.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I do think the companies, Charles, could be doing more.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: They should be doing more.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: They created the situation, I think, that they can figure out a way to make it better. The problem is there're no guard rails. That's what's so frightening. And that's why the parents are saying, look at what is happening to our children.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: We're all complicit. We're all -- but the companies are complicit, where parents are complicit, there should be many guardrails.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: We got work to do, America.This is a Selfie's Choice for the smart phone era. Most of us have smart phones. You guys have smart phones. Everybody in here is a smart phone. You do have a smart phone.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I do.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: And if you walk around with a flip phone, who knows? You're not on social media.So, Siggi's, a yogurt company, is offering to pay people $10,000 if you lock away your smart phone for a month, a digital detox. Would you do it? We should say that they will give you a flip phone.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I would really do it. KING

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Because I'm going to save money. You know, so many people ask me for money on a given day and a given week.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Because you also told us Charles you walk around with bags of cash. That's crazy.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: People you know, people you know?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, family and friends. And it drives me crazy. It makes me feel bad.So, if I could get away from that, I'd make -- I'd come out ahead. But because I get frustrated like I'm not a bank, I'm not an ATM.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: You've never even been to the ATM.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I can't get enough money out of that thing, Gayle.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: But you've never really never been to the ATM.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I've never used ATM.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Why Charles?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Because you can't get enough money out of it, Gayle.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: You sound like an old man that hasn't caught up with the times.Gayle, I am an old man who haven't caught up with the times.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: We've been talking about a new streaming. There's a new streaming champion. New streaming champion for the year of 2023, do you know who the number one show was on streaming? Suits.You've seen Suits.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I love Suits.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I didn't see it when it was on. It was the most streamed show ever in a single year with 58 billion minutes, that's billion with a B, watched. The previous record, by the way, was 57 million. That was set by The Office back in 2020.I love Suits. I mean, I love The Office. I've never seen Suits. Suits ran from 2011 to 2019 featuring the future Dutchess of Sussex. Sussex, that's Meghan Markle. That's why I think led to the streaming uptick, because I think people want --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: No, it wasn't.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes. I believe people want to just see Meghan on that show.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, there was other people on the show.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: There was other people on the show?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, there was other people on the show.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: He says, who is a secret to the success of Suits? I say it's Meghan because, listen, I like Meghan Markle and I think people are curious to see how she did.What do you what do you attribute --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I think it was me and Harvey, me and Harvey on the show.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Please roll the tape.(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Harvey, you were right. That's one of the best steaks I ever had. I want you to tell me why you actually bought me here.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Can't the man just take his client out to dinner?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: A man can, but you need something. And I just did you that little favor.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: That wasn't a favor.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I took 15 minutes of picture with some dipshit from Philadelphia. That's not a favor.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: That was an appetizer. I need you to get Magic, Bird, Hakeem and Michael to do the same thing.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You're a funny guy, you're kidding right?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Did I ask you if you were kidding me when you called me that night?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You asked me to sign with you and I did.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: And I also said that I would need something from you someday, and taking selfies with some dipshit Sixers fan isn't going to cut it.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Harvey, you need to chill with this soul off (ph) thing. If not, every single day you go into the office, he's going to be trying to stab you in the back.(END VIDEO CLIP) KING: See? I think we've seen enough. We've seen enough. We've seen enough. If I didn't know better, Charles. I would say that was artificial intelligence, deep fake.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Did you really do that?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: First of all, artificial intelligence, we call that a work shack (ph). First of all, that was my favorite show. That was Gabriel Macht. I think it was so much fun. I feel --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: So, how did you get to -- how did that happen?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: They found out, because I talked about it on the show all the time, and they invited me to do a cameo. It was really cool. I had a great time. I got to ask them to meet Meghan.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Oh, you did? Okay.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Everybody, my man Rich was on there. I met them all. It was really awesome. It was one of the coolest experiences of my life.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: So, they heard that you liked it and they invited you to come on?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: To do a cameo.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: So, were you playing Charles Barkley?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes, I played Charles Barkley, but it was fun, though, yes. You know, Toronto's my favorite city in the world. I mean, I'm never going to go there again because the Raptors suck.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: And they speak so highly of you. But one more thing, how many takes did it take you to do that, playing Charles Barkley, doing Charles Barkley.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, you know, when you do a commercial, it takes a little time. I think it took about three hours to shoot that little spot. But it was cool because Gabriel was awesome.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: A round of applause for Charles Barkley, the actor, the actor.We have Bob Costas in the studio tonight, but coming up next, Democrats and Republicans in Congress finally trying to work together on something. But former President Donald Trump is telling him to blow it all up. We'll explain. We'll unpack that with our panel right after the break. You are watching King Charles. Be right back. (COMMERCIAL BREAK) [22:15:00] KING: Welcome back. It does seem like we can all agree on this, that we need to come up with some kind of solution for the crisis at the border. You've seen what's happening there. The Senate has been negotiating a bipartisan immigration bill, but Presidential Candidate Donald Trump has other plans. He's reportedly asked members of his own party to block a bipartisan deal and save it as a campaign issue, request that is seen as divisive, even among his fellow Republicans. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP) REP. MIKE JOHNSON (R-LA): We have a catastrophe at our southern border. It is because the border has been deliberately opened wide that we see the terrific horrors that are taking place across our country right now. Mr. President, it says very clearly you have all the tools and the executive authority necessary to reverse the catastrophe that you have created. SEN. MITT ROMNEY (R-UT): I think the border is a very important issue for Donald Trump. And the fact that he would communicate to Republican senators and Congress people that he doesn't want us to solve the border problem because he wants to blame Biden for it is really appalling. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Appalling is the word a lot of people are using.To help us unpack this, our political historian and author her name is Leah Wright Rigueur, I love that name, alongside Hari Kondabolu. The New York Times called him one of the most exciting political comedians in stand-up. Hello, exciting political comedian in stand-up. Leah, it's nice to have you here. So, what do you make of this? It's a bipartisan deal that people say has gone farther than many, many in the past, and yet there seems to be a movement to stop it.

utterances.speaker: RIGUEUR
utterances.sentences: And they don't exist. They, that's a really important --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Who doesn't exist?

utterances.speaker: RIGUEUER
utterances.sentences: Those middle of the road, these mythical independents who, you know, don't vote Republican, don't vote Democrat, that's actually not true. What we have in this country are people who may say they're independent, but they either vote Republican or Democrat.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, number one, I want to thank Senator Romney for actually saying the right thing.We need to do something about immigration. We were watching the story earlier about people living on the bridge in Colorado. You know, they got to be freezing to death. But I'm going to pick it back on something you said. These politicians, they're afraid of Trump's base because they got to go back to their state and run for office. That's why they're afraid. This dude has so much power over the MAGA group. These politicians, they are afraid.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Even though they disagree with them, Charles, they won't speak up.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Because they have to go back to their state and win their election. And that's what they're afraid of. I'm so proud. I mean, Romney is retiring, but at least he got the courage to stand up and say, we need to fix our immigration thing right now. To push it, to kick the can down the road and wait another month, two, three, four, six, it just makes things even worse. But I'm glad he did have the courage to say it because it's appalling.And this is a serious issue. And we don't need --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Which is only getting worse.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: And it's only going to get worse that we keep pushing the -- kicking the can down the line. But this dude has so much power. These politicians and some of these guys are cowards, to be honest with you, because some of the stuff he said about them, their wives and their families, you know, we had to --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: And they're now supporting him.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: We had that conversation, I think, last week. Listen, I don't mind having different opinions and people, but if you were to get personal, I'm not endorsing you. And that will let me know that they're cowards.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: What do you think? I'm curious here are your thoughts about how Donald Trump handles Nikki Haley and his language that he uses to describe her and how he's taken her.We have a sound bite? All right. We'll play it for you. We'll play it for you. (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Do you think Trump mocking your birth name was racist?

utterances.speaker: NIKKI HALEY, REPUBLICAN PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: I mean, I think we can let other people decide that. I think that you look at it and it's kind of like the Tim Scott, you sleep with yourself. I mean, we'll let Donald Trump sleep with that all he wants.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KONDABOLU
utterances.sentences: I'm pretending I'm sipping tea right now.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: How's that tea taste, Hari?

utterances.speaker: KONDABOLU
utterances.sentences: I mean, bitter. You know, it just feels she almost deserves what she gets in this situation.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: What do you mean?

utterances.speaker: KONDABOLU
utterances.sentences: Because it's clearly racist. It's a loud dog whistle. He's basically -- it's a dog scream, the bark.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: It's not subtle. It's a megaphone.

utterances.speaker: KONDABOLU
utterances.sentences: It's a megaphone. You're saying, Nimrata, and then having people laugh, you know what I mean? Like it's just short of -- and she smells like curry. Like it's middle school bullying. And instead of standing up for yourself and said, yes, my name is Nimrata, I'm proud of it and I have no issue with it, and what you're doing is racist.She's not going to do that because she doesn't want to lose the racist demographic. That's what she's fighting for. Because if she uses the R word, which is racism, then it's done, she's going to alienate so many people. She doesn't want to lose those people. What are you fighting for then?

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: That was unfortunate.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: First of all, that was unfortunate and stupid for her to say, but it really bothered me. What really bothered me the most, she was trying to reach his base. And that's what really bothered me more than anything. Because she's like, well, I'm trying to appeal to his voters, that's why she said America has never been racist. That bothered me more than anything.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: So you don't like how she's handling it though? You don't like that?

utterances.speaker: KONDABOLU
utterances.sentences: No. I don't like how she's handling it at all. It doesn't show respect and dignity for yourself, if anything. And, for me, it's like, man, we finally got rid of Bobby Jindal and now I got to deal with this? It's just --

utterances.speaker: RIGUEUR
utterances.sentences: But can we talk about the environment where she said this too? She's on the Breakfast Club, which everybody knows --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Charlamagne tha God, D.J. Envy, yes.

utterances.speaker: RIGUEUR
utterances.sentences: Exactly. And the demographic, the target demographic of the Breakfast Club is urban audiences and/or African-American, black minority listeners. So, that was the perfect opportunity to come on and say, actually, you know what? It was racist.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: So, you guys don't think she's in a tough spot in terms of she doesn't want -- she still needs those voters. She still needs those voters. So, she's trying to straddle both sides of teams.

utterances.speaker: KONDABOLU
utterances.sentences: But at the end of the day, candidates get elected because of who they think you are. But we don't know who she is, because if she's not even going to stand up for herself there, who are you? What do you stand for? What do you get -- like, when you're in these situations and you find a way to talk around them as opposed to answering them, well, I don't know who you are. At least with Trump, you know who he is.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.sentences: Well, shout out to the newest members of the Chief's Kingdom, Taylor Swift, who has officially reached the Super Bowl in her rookie year.

utterances.speaker: TRAVIS KELCE, KANSAS CITY CHIEFS
utterances.sentences: Shout out to Taylor. Thanks for joining the team.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yeah, she's joined the team. She has definitely joined the team. Taylor, Travis, and the Super Bowl, everybody's talking about. A lot of them are kind of irritated by it, but not us here at King Charles. Why? Because we love sports and we love, love.With us now is a legend among legends, you could say. Bob Costas is here. He's hosted coverage of -- listen to this roster, NFL, NBA, MLB, golf, 12 Olympics and so much more. And he's won, how many of awards has this man won, Charles?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: That's got to be a misprint, it's a 28.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: It's a -- 28 awards. And Bob Costas --

utterances.speaker: BOB COSTAS, SPORTS BROADCASTER
utterances.sentences: That is actually a misprint.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Oh, how many is it? Twenty nine?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: No, it's going to be more.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: It's 29.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: It's 29.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: I'm not supposed to know that, but I do because I've heard it often.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Twenty nine.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, I will admit, I used to hate you.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Why?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Because --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: That's his way of saying welcome to the show, Bob.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: No, I had to get --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: What do you mean? What do you mean?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: No, this is actually true.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Okay. BARKLEY

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Oh yeah.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: And we'd have to sit there like, it's all right, Ernie. Bob won every year. So, I'm just -- I did hate you for a minute.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Eventually -- eventually, Ernie won a handful himself, and he deserves every one of them. He's terrific.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: But you -- but you, just reading the stuff you covered --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: That's just amazing. Amazing.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Because it's so many different kind of sports. That's what's so cool about you. We can also say he's a truth teller, because when Bob Costas has sat down in the seat, can I please get a close-up shot of my face? He sat down and goes, God, that thing's getting bigger. Look.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: It's getting bigger as the hours progress. I said we're going to try to make it through the hour. Hopefully it won't get so big. But the first thing you said, God, that thing is getting bigger.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Yeah. I hope it doesn't hurt.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: And guess what, Bob? It hurts. It hurts. But we're really glad you're here because I want to talk about the Super Bowl. It's coming up. What excites you most about the Super Bowl?

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Well --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Because it is like nothing else.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: I think the Chiefs now, it can safely be said, are America's team. The Dallas Cowboys have had that moniker for a long time, and they're still a glamour franchise, but they haven't been to the Super Bowl since the mid-90s.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: For a hot minute, they were saying Detroit is America's team. For a hot minute.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Sentimentally, yeah. They would have been a sentimental favorite if they got to the Super Bowl, and it would have been a great storyline, 49ers are a good storyline, too. But now, the Chiefs have been to four of the last five Super Bowls.They have the best quarterback in the game, even though there are others who are really good. He's exciting, he improvises, he's charismatic. They've got him. Andy Reid's been around a long time, went to the Super Bowl with Philadelphia and now with the Chiefs. They've got Travis Kelce and his romance with Taylor Swift.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: He was a big deal to begin with, and now it blows up bigger. Plus, the State Farm commercials. You don't have to know a screen pass from a field goal to know something about the Kansas City Chiefs. So, they're America's team.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: But you guys know that now men are going to the barber shops, taking a picture of Travis Kelce with them, saying they want the Travis Kelce haircut, because they think that will help them get more dates. What do you think?

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Well, yeah, provided they're, you know, 6'5 and ripped.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: And are headed to the Hall of Fame in Canton, I think they'll do well romantically if they can match up across the board with the haircut on top of it.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: But people are captivated by this love story.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: What do you make of it?

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I just think -- I think it's great.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: I don't understand the people who have a problem with it.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Exactly, Bob.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: You know in the NBA Chuck, when Jack Nicholson was courtside for the Showtime Lakers, they took shots of him all the time. When the Yankees were doing great in the 90s, early 2000s, Jerry Seinfeld would be at the game sitting with Chris Rock. It's part of the scene. And you know, "The New York Times" had a piece the other day where they actually timed how many seconds per game Taylor Swift is on camera. It isn't that much. And when you watch a football game --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Because they're not covering, they're not taking her when there's a play going on.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: No, of course not.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: They're taking her reactions --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: -- to certain things.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: But you also see the reactions of drunken guys with no shirt on when it's 10 degrees below zero. And you're supposed to be charmed by that. I'd rather look at Taylor Swift.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I was sitting -- I watched a tape where fans were screaming at her as she was leaving the game. If you're screaming at her because your team lost, I heard a couple guys --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Was screaming negatively about her?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Oh, yeah.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: What were they saying?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: You ruin football.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: No, please. Please.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I said, wait a minute. Please. You just, first I'll just say, I'm going to look right in that camera. If you're screaming at Taylor Swift saying she ruined it, you're just a loser. You're just a loser or a jackass. You can be A or B.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: One of the two.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: You know what? When it comes to the Super Bowl, where a lot of people who don't watch football all-year long, double the audience, even at the conference championship games, part of that is the half- time entertainment.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: A huge part of it is the commercials.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: So, for people, all of a sudden, because they don't like something about Taylor Swift, either they don't like the Chiefs or they've inferred that Taylor Swift might not be a Trumper, then they're annoyed by Taylor Swift. I can guarantee you that all this news on Fox News would not be happening if she was wearing a MAGA hat.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: They would love it.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Oh. But look at all the new people she's brought to the NFL. COSTAS

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: You see young teen girls who are now watching football.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: And it's hard to imagine the Super Bowl could have a larger rating. But in a small percentage, it may even up that. And in terms of merchandise sales --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: - the Travis Kelce jerseys and all the rest, and the attention to regular season games, the NFL reigns supreme not only over sports, but over all of American entertainment. In a fractionalized universe, it's the only thing that consistently aggregates huge audiences, like 90 of the top 100 rated television shows in a given year are football games, almost all of them NFL games. And so, you would think they couldn't improve on that, but now they've tapped into another demographic.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: One thing that really warmed my heart, I've seen a bunch of dads watching the game with their daughters.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes, I like it. And I was like, if you can't be happy, because as men, we're always trying to spend time with our daughters, they're the most important thing in the world. And these young girls, like dad, what's a screen pass?

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: What's pass and a fair -- and I'm sitting there like --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: What's a wide receiver? That's a tight end.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: A tight end, they want to know because that's Travis.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Have you ever seen a power couple, a sports power couple, that brings all of this together? This big before?

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: No, because you've got all the elements. The popularity of football, the fact that the games are on television, that the Chiefs have advanced all the way through to the Super Bowl. On an international level, you had Victoria and David Beckham in the soccer world. Justin Verlander is married to Kate Upton, and Justin Verlander is headed for the Hall of Fame as a pitcher.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Baseball.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Way back when, the original one was probably Joe DiMaggio and Marilyn Monroe. But when they got together and were briefly married, JoDi's playing career was over. Plus, it was a black and white world. You didn't have all the outlets and all the gossip stuff and whatnot.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: But they were both at the top of their game. And say what you want, she can write a great song.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: But also, you got the fact that this was the summer of her and Beyonce.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Like, I mean, you went to both concerts.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes, I did.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: This summer, from an entertainment standpoint, there was nothing in the world happening more important, entertainment-wise, than Taylor Swift and Beyonce. It was the summer of women.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Bob Costas, we don't want you to leave. We're going to take a break.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Okay, I'm going to do this in 10 seconds because I'll never have another chance.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: One Mississippi, two Mississippi. Go, Bob, go.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Marilyn Monroe comes back from a goodwill tour during the Korean War to Korea. And she gets off the plane and Joe DiMaggio greets her. And she says, Joe, you've never heard such cheering. And he was a terse man. He said, yes, I have.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Oh.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I like that.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: I'll make this statement, you agree or disagree. Charles Barkley is a great, great player, but Michael Jordan is in a class by himself clearly superior to anybody else in the league.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I have another drink, Bob. I would never say another player is better than me. Never.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Wow. We are back with sports' second most iconic power couple, Bob Costas is still here. I love looking at that old video of you, Charles.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I love that and I meant every word. No and that's not --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: It sounds a little arrogant though, I have to say. BARKLEYFirst of all, you can never be great at sports if you don't think you're better than everybody else.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Do you think that's true, Bob?

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: You do?

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Yes. Some guys don't wear it on their sleeves --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: - but the great ones have to believe, even if --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: They have to believe that on this night or in this match, that I am at least the equal of this guy.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Gayle, I got to play against Bird, Magic, Kareem, Karl Malone, Michael Jordan. There's no way I can look myself in the mirror if I went into a game saying, that guy's better than me. No. First of all, that was a bit --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: What about I'm just as good or we're equal as opposed to I'm better than? I don't know, that just sounds --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Well, we're not out here trying to be equal. You're trying to be better than people, Gayle.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Gayle, that was 31 years ago. The 1993 finals.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Thirty one years ago that interview was about? Wow.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Yeah, 1993, the Bulls against the Suns, and one game went triple overtime in Chicago.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: And Charles had like 56 that night and like 25 rebounds. So, you know, he was one of the greatest players.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Was he good?

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: He was damn good.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Google me, Gale.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: He was damn good.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Google me.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I think I do need to, because I said, walking with Charles Barkley, what did I say? You were a power guard?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Oh, don't do that.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Oh, she did.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I know. And then he went, excuse me. Yes.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Hanging with Gale has been really humbling for me. She called me a power guard one day. And last week, this girl took a picture. And since she said, yeah, I just sent a picture of Gale King and some dude.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: And some dude.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Then she sent it to her mother and her mother said, that's awesome, dude. That's a great Charles Barkley. But he said, no, I was a power forward.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Yes, he was. And at 6'5", might have been really only 6'4", listed at 6'5", he was out rebounding guys who were 6'8", 6'9" and 6'10". He was the round mound of rebound.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I got to get our crack staff on these notes and put that in there.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Yeah. By the way, he would have so much fun though. I've never told him this story. I'm at a game in the late 80s. He's playing with the 76ers. And I'm sitting with Ahmad Rashad along the baseline, actually not the baseline, sideline, like in the Spike Lee seats.And for some reason, Mike Tyson shows up at the game, and the ushers are taking him down the seats and around the court, and they're going to seat him next to me and Ahmad as it happens. And he passes under the basket along the baseline, and the ball goes out of bounds, and Charles saves it in bounds, and now the Sixers are going back the other way. But now he's face to face with Mike Tyson. And he stops and shakes Tyson's hand and talks to him.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: On the court?

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: No, not on the court, but under the other basket. Meanwhile, the game is going on.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: While the game is in progress?

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: He's just enjoying himself.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I'm a big boxing fan, Gayle.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Oh my gosh. You see?

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Very few other people would do that.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yeah. And there's a reason for that. But you just said he scored 50 what?

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Fifty six, I think he had in that game.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: So, lately, we've been seeing all these guys scoring. Like, Lucas scored 73 points. Joel Embiid, 70 points. Giannis is 64, Devin Booker 62, Karl Anthony Towns 62. What do you guys make of these high- scoring games?

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Well, the reliance now on the three-pointer, which used to be a punctuation, and now it's a strategy. A disproportionate number of shots taken are threes. The mid-range jumper, you don't see as much anymore. Defenses are different now. You know, Michael Jordan's last game, the epic closing shot against Utah, the final score in that game is 87 to 86, the last game of the 98 finals. And he scored 45. Now, 45 out of 87 is a different thing than what's the norm now. The average game is probably 20 points higher than it was during your career.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Do you think it's the three-pointer, too? Why they're going these --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: It's a three-pointer, first and foremost, but also these millennials have ruined my game.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: How so?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: It's become a three-point shooting contest. You can't play defense. It's kind of similar what's happened to the NFL. You just going to throw the ball 34 to 50 times a game. You can't play any defense on the wide receivers. Now, if you go back and look, I guarantee you there's 10 to 15 points difference in scoring from the 70s, 80s to the 2020s in football.It's the same thing in basketball. It's become a three-point shooting contest. Steve Kerr has actually been going crazy about this lately. You can't play defense anymore.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: But Charles, you're not drinking a little glass of Haterade, are you?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: No, no.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: When you say these guys have ruined my game. No, because that sounds like the old man who's still saying when I used to play --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: No, anytime you said it, that's what they say to old guys. But Bob's got two points.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Number one, the three point shots and free throws. That's the reason scoring is going through the roof. You can't just sit here and say players are --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: They're not better players? Oh --

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: They've been Michael Jordan? Or they've been Magic Johnson. They've been Larry Bird. They're not.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: There's nobody ever -- listen. As much as I love LeBron --

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes, we do.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: He and Kobe Bryant.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Yes, we do.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: These guys aren't as good. LeBron's not on that list. Kobe Bryant's not on that list. Michael Jordan's not on that list.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Kobe scored 81 in one game.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: He did. But he didn't rely on the three. If he was shooting threes, he'd have had 102.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: Maybe.

utterances.speaker: COSTAS
utterances.sentences: You know, bad.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Have you seen the Wizards and the Pistols play? They should never get 125 points, ever.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: I don't know, it sounds like hatred from this side of the room, but I'm just saying. But you still admire the work that they do and love this game.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: I admire, I love the game. It's given me every single thing in my life, Gayle. I love the game.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: That'll do it for us. Has my lip gotten bigger?

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: No, it hadn't gotten bigger.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Because I'm rushing to the airport, I got to catch a flight in 45 minutes. Will she make it? Yes, she will. We thank you for watching. We'll be back in two weeks on Valentine's Day, 10 o'clock. Just do it with this information.

utterances.speaker: BARKLEY
utterances.sentences: Hey, have fun at the Grammys, Gayle. Have fun at the Grammys.

utterances.speaker: KING
utterances.sentences: Valentine's Day in two weeks. I wear a size 10 shoe, 10 or 12 dress. Do with that what you will. You can catch us on, you can catch me on CBS morning, 7 o'clock, but right now I'm going to the airports. I will not be there tomorrow morning. Abby Phillip will be right here tomorrow night at 10 o'clock. You don't want to miss that. But don't go anywhere because "Laura Coates Live" starts --
